title: Ticket #2265: Machine ads/condor_startd should advertise no more Memory than ulimit
description:
Condor may be running subject to memory limits set via ulimit/setrlimit. In particular the maximum virtual memory size (RLIMIT_AS) and the maximum data segment size (RLIMIT_DATA). (Also maybe the maximum resident set size. RLIMIT_RSS)) Condor should detect this (getrlimit), and if any such limit is smaller than the calculated Memory total, set Memory to the smallest relevant limit.

Reasoning: We are encountering a site that is advertising memory of 4,096, but apparently hitting a lower limit of about 1,536. There is no point in advertising RAM we can't actually use.

Worth considering: While individual processes may be limited 1,536 MB, what if my job needs 4,096 MB spread evenly across 4 or more processes? Then I could run on such a machine. However, such a case seems likely rare and not worth the complexity of coping with it.

Worth being aware of: #2266: Condor should optionally enforce rlimits on RAM, file size
